FMT produces high quality near-real time MPEG encoding engines based on super computers. FMT's software encoder incoporates proprietary pre-processing, detelecine, bit allocation algorithms which enables very high quality compression even at low bit rates.

FutureTel

1092 E. Arques Ave.

Contact : Cynthia Hammond (cindyh@FutureTel.com)

Tel. : (408) 522-1400

Fax : (408) 522-1439

WWW : http://www.ftelinc.com

FutureTel products address the needs of companies that want to publish and/or distribute video in digital format. Driven by the need for interactivity and lower distribution costs, the broadcast, entertainment, and training industries are making the transition from analog to digital distribution of content. The bandwidth limitations of existing distribution options demand the use of MPEG compression technology.

Hewlett-Packard Company

Test and Measurement Organization

5301 Stevens Creek Blvd.

Building 52U-VL

Santa Clara, CA 95052-8059

USA

Tel. USA : 1-303-649-5637, 1-800-452-4844

Tel. Europe : +41-22-780-4111

Tel. Japan : +81 426-48-3860

Tel. Asia Pacific : 852 2599-7070

WWW : http://www.hp.com

Hewlett-Packard has developed a full-service real-time encoder system that turns analog broadcast signals into network-ready digital data, sending it out on an MPEG-2 transport stream on ATM. This system enables cable TV or telecom companies to quickly and easily provide real-time live broadcast services to their subscribers over a digital network. It can also be used to capture and store live broadcast signals to be made available to subscribers through "time-delayed TV" applications. HP is currently delivering the real-time encoder system to Bell South. HP has also released the HP E4226A MPEG Protocol Viewer application for the industry standard HP E4200 Broadband Series Test System. The E4226A is the first commercially available MPEG tester.

MPR Teltech, Ltd.

Multimedia Telecommunications

8999 Nelson Way

Burnaby, B.C.

Canada V5A 4B5

Tel. : 604-293-5183

Fax : 604-293-5787

WWW : http://www.mpr.ca/

Email : info@mpr.ca

MPR Teltech is a high-tech telecommunications company of 600+ employees based in Vancouver, B.C. Canada. The Multimedia Telecommunications unit is actively involved in the development of MPEG audio products for the radio broadcast and audio production industries. They initially started with perceptual coding by developing the first subjective listening test system for testing high quality audio equipment. This is currently being used by the most discriminating audio professionals in the world, such as the IRT, CCETT, Swedish Broadcasting, Canadian Broadcasting Corp., and others. Since then, they launched the L2 Blue MPEG Layer II digital audio codec and the Capella MPEG Layer II PC audio codec.

Optibase is a leading provider of MPEG-1 encoders to the industry. Its first encoder was shipped in 1992 and now hold close to a 75% market share in all MPEG-1 encoders. Optibase also sells MPEG-1 and MPEG-2 decoders to CATV and VOD markets.
